author: Simon Difford
description: Originally topped with lambrusco, I've opted for prosecco but some, like me, may prefer champagne or other brut sparkling wine. Whichever you choose, the result is cognac-laced bittersweet herbal and lightly vivacious aperitivo or digestivo.
name: Rome is Burning
recipeIngredient: 22.5 ml Punt E Mes or other full-bodied vermouth

recipeInstructions.text: STIR first 4 ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass
